_header: Right noble and blessed father to whom of excellence
Subjects: Wainfleet, William, Bishop of Winchester (1447-86); clergy; occasional verse
_description: Poem addressed to William Waynflete as Bishop of Winchester, c. 1451 — 128 lines in eight-line stanzas

BLAdd60577.First Lines:
ryght noble & blessede fader to whom of excellenceThe flour ys
                    proclamed thorowe ought thys realme wyde…
BLAdd60577.Last Lines:
…Thus I be seche your lordeshyppe to be mery thys nyghtAnd
                    take thys lytyl braunche of a chylde of youres
